author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> Is there any limit on batches that a rollup might commit per Ethereum block?

author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> i.e., if a rollup have a huge amount of usage can it commit two batches in a single Ethereum block?

author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> and if the transactions processed in that time period in an L2 require a lot of DA (e.g., 12 blobs in ethereum), will the rollup send 2 transactions (each containing 6 blobs) in the Ethereum mempool

author: bridge-bot
content:
<thegaram33> re: **@schaliasos**
> Is there any limit on batches that a rollup might commit per Ethereum block?
current limit is 9 blobs per Ethereum block. a rollup can commit batches with 1-9 blobs per transaction. this depends mainly on submission strategy. having more blobs per tx is generally cheaper, but I suspect inclusion of 9-blob transactions might be slower (not sure).

author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> what is the target of the EIP-1559 mechanism? 3?

author: bridge-bot
content: <thegaram33> max was increased to 9 in yesterday's Pectra upgrade ðŸ˜Ž https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7691

author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> so, my question is what rollups are doing if they have a lot of usage (with high DA requirements), do they submit 2 transactions (with one batch each) on the L1 mempool (although only one will be picked if submitted with the same price)?

author: bridge-bot
content: <thegaram33> they can submit 2 or more commit transactions in parallel by using different transaction nonces.

author: bridge-bot
content: <schaliasos> though won't be included sequentially I guess because of the price increase (and their users had paid for DA in the current DA price), so some cool down period needs to pass so the second commit transactions will be included in the L1

author: bridge-bot
content: <Highlander1969> If the L2 is willing to pay for it, why not. It's an auction process for block building

author: bridge-bot
content:
<tsahizid> re: **@schaliasos**
> so, my question is what rollups are doing if they have a lot of usage (with high DA requirements), do they submit 2 transactions (with one batch each) on the L1 mempool (although only one will be picked if submitted with the same price)?
We will many times have multiple outgoing batch-posting transactions that could be included in the same block. We generally have 3 blobs per transaction.
